message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

The paper proposes a system for title construction from scientific abstracts, which involves extracting important words from the text. This task falls under the domain of natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), which are covered by the sub-categories cs.CL and cs.IR, respectively. The paper also mentions the use of a supervised model for keyword extraction, which involves machine learning techniques such as feature engineering and classification. This aligns with the sub-categories cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.AI (artificial intelligence). Finally, the paper mentions the use of graph-based features for keyword extraction, which is a common technique in deep learning and neural networks, covered by the sub-category cs.DL (deep learning).
